intro: Cnidium intermedium, commonly known as the Chinese pepper plant, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic, often reddish-brown roots. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. Its roots are used in traditional medicine for their purported anti-inflammatory and antispasmodic properties. The plant thrives in temperate climates and is often cultivated for its medicinal and culinary uses.
